channel.title: Project insanity: how do i get it to run in windows 7
channel.description:
Okay I need to run the client in windows 7.
i try to open 'Run' and i get an error
Pic: [img]http://i1183.photobucket.com/albums/x476/storm155/Untitled-1.png[/img]
The code in the 'Run' file: [code]@echo off title Client java -Xmx300m Jframe 10 0 highmem members 32 pause---------------[/code]
Please help.

@laylow wrote:

Can some1 help me ? How i can make project insanity run on windows 7 ? when i open run server the box is keeping flashing …

Read full topic
item.source: Project insanity: how do i get it to run in windows 7

item.title: Project insanity: how do i get it to run in windows 7
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

Go to C:/Program Files/Java and there you can see the folder name, that will be the path to your JRE.

Example:

"C:/Program File (x86)/Java/jdk1.6.0_16/bin/java.exe".

Every source is different so you need to tailor the batch file to your path, your main class and any other attribute such as lowmem 32 0 0, if any.

You usually only have to change the JRE path though. And also I suggest double checking your Enviroment Variables.

Read full topic

item.title: Project insanity: how do i get it to run in windows 7
item.dc:creator: @DannyIsSoPro DannyIsSoPro
item.description:
@DannyIsSoPro wrote:

@echo off
Title Client
cd ./Class/
“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\javaw.exe” -Xmx1500m Gui 30 0 lowmem members 32
exit

That’s what my friends use to start my client.

Read full topic
